refnamediv.refpurpose: Punctuation separating an index term from its list of page references in an index

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: This parameter contains the text to insert between the end of an index term and its list of page references. Typically that might be a comma and a space.

Because this text may be locale dependent, this parameter's value is taken from a gentext template named 'term-separator' in the context 'index' in the stylesheet locale file for the language of the current document.

So this text string can be customized in two ways. You can override the default gentext string using the local.l10n.xml parameter, or you can directly replace the content of this parameter. The content can be a simple string, or it can be something more complex such as a call-template. For fo output, it could be an fo:leader element to provide space of a specific length, or a dot leader.
